Q8: The connector is a crucial aspect to use in each urbanism design. However I missed an explanation of the underlying importance of the instruments: why to connect and what to connect. (Thats also why it makes more sense to introduce the connector after the sponge so you know what to connect.) For ecological networks, most of us already know why: movement of water, species, and so on. But also for the social spaces, it is important to have safe connections so children and other vulnerable people can safely move from library, to school, to swimming pool, to church, ... The connector needs to tell us what pathways are priority to develop in a green and a safe way.
Q11_1: Neither difficult or easy to use
Q11_2: Neither difficult or easy to use
Q11_3: Neither difficult or easy to use
Q15: Identifying the most important spaces is the first step. Before doing this a discussion of what spaces are important in our current society would be useful. The sponge is only the tool, but the way you use it, is what is truly important. I still strongly believe that economic spaces should be the fourth layer to complete hydrologic, ecologic, and community spaces. Academic designs are often focused on the last three, but in reality many decisions are based on economic spaces. When we can convince people that green and social spaces are productive as well, it will become easier to install them.
Q22: As already mentioned: in my belief, the conflict does not arise when overlapping the sponge and the connector, but it comes from overlapping different layers of different actors with different interests. There is a huge amount of monocultures, grasslawn parks, highrise residences,... which all serve one particular purpose. We need to diversify the landscape and intesify its usage. Finding synergies between the hydrologic, ecologic, economic, and social spaces is our task.
Q29: The tree previous instruments can be used on each scale, ofcourse with very different intentions and very different results. Not much to say about it, very interesting was to idea of 'constraints' following from the big scale. Similarly the scale of components is important because it shows how certain ideas can actually be implemented in reality.
Q33: No
Q35: The integrator is the most important!! Doing the sponge and the connector for each scale (and each of the layers ecology, hydrology, economy and community) is relatively easy. The integrator can be done at the end and the project will develop from it.

Q35:
I would do two things:
1. Present the 4 instruments at the beginning
2. Use the 21 nationalities background and experience to do a first session where these 4 instruments are presented and an exercise where each of the participants can respond from study cases they now. 

This could allow interiorizing faster the instruments to then do the research and design in the specific site while giving also feedback on how the instruments could be easily implemented in other contexts.

A round quick test.
